title: Ghana's Pan African Heritage Museum seeks to reclaim Africa's history
description: A new museum in Ghana aims to tell the story of Africa using African voices, tools and culture.

title: Thailand cannabis: From a war on drugs to weed curries
description: The country now has one of the world's most liberal marijuana regimes. How did that happen?

title: Prince William turns 40: Birthday photos show duke's priorities
description: As he turns 40, the duke conveys his focus on issues like homelessness and the environment.

title: Rail strikes: Parties struggle to deal with the politics of pain
description: Strikes and inflation create major headaches for both the Conservatives and Labour.

title: 'Rail strikes have lost us £500,000 of bookings'
description: Businesses, commuters and pupils sitting exams anticipate disruption from this week's train strikes.

title: Ros Atkins on… Why rail strikes are happening
description: Ros Atkins examines why a dispute between the RMT union and employers has led to strike action.

title: International Space Station captured travelling in front of Sun
description: Jamie Cooper planned for days to capture the moment, which lasted for less than a second.

title: How the strike will affect passengers in Wales
description: There will be no trains west of Cardiff or north of Merthyr Tydfil when rail workers strike this week.

title: Pwllheli: Lucky rabbit survives 40-mile ride in car grille
description: A driver describes hearing a "dreaded thump" and fearing the worst - yet the rabbit survived.

title: World's largest freshwater fish found in Cambodia
description: A 300kg stingray found in Cambodia is the biggest freshwater fish on record, scientists say.

title: Why Belgium is returning an African hero's gold tooth
description: All that remains of Congo's murdered leader Patrice Lumumba is handed to his family in Brussels.

title: The family separated by war in both life and death
description: A bereaved father in Ukraine is separated from his daughter, who is receiving medical treatment abroad.

title: Free school meals: Wales' rollout starts in September
description: Reception classes are the first, with every primary age pupil entitled to them by 2024.

title: Boris Johnson returns to No 10 after minor sinus operation
description: Deputy PM Dominic Raab would make any urgent decisions in Boris Johnson's place, Downing Street says.

title: Rail strike: Travellers face 'misery' in biggest walkout in 30 years
description: Passengers are being advised to avoid travel as services wind down from Monday evening.

title: C4 subtitle problems breached licence conditions, Ofcom finds
description: A prolonged outage last year cut off subtitles, audio description and sign language services.

title: Commonwealth Games 2022: Natalie Metcalf to captain England
description: Natalie Metcalf will take on the England captaincy for their Commonwealth Games title defence, which begins in Birmingham next month.

title: Australia v England: Eddie Jones names squad for three-Test series in July
description: Billy Vunipola and Danny Care are named alongside eight uncapped players in England's squad for their three-Test tour in Australia next month.

title: Ungovernable? France takes stock after Macron loses majority
description: The French government seeks to avoid political paralysis after losing its parliamentary majority.

title: Prince William describes why he sold The Big Issue on London street
description: The duke says a trip to a homeless shelter with his mother when he was 11 continues to influence him.

title: Nayef Aguerd: West Ham complete £30m deal to sign Rennes defender
description: West Ham have completed the signing of Morocco defender Nayef Aguerd from Ligue 1 side Rennes for £30m.

title: Archie Battersbee: Family of boy ruled dead seeks appeal
description: The parents of a 12-year-old boy in a coma are in court contesting a ruling that he is brain-dead.

title: 5,000 people hit by Heathrow flight cancellations
description: The latest disruption comes as EasyJet announced it will reduce flights this summer.

title: Primark finally goes online in new click-and-collect trial
description: The retailer will trial click-and-collect at stores after long resisting selling on the internet.

title: Glastonbury Festival: Half of all trains to site cancelled
description: Travel problems are expected as 200,000 people descend on Pilton amid national rail strikes.

title: Russia blockading Ukrainian grain is a 'real war crime' - EU
description: Russia is stopping grain leaving Ukrainian ports, sparking warnings tens of millions risk famine.

title: Japan: Osaka court rules ban on same-sex marriage constitutional
description: The ruling is a setback for activists hoping the government will change the country’s marriage law.

title: Oscar-winning director Paul Haggis arrested over alleged sexual assault
description: The Crash filmmaker is arrested in Italy and denies the allegations according to local agencies.

title: Energy firms face limit on direct debit overpayment
description: Ofgem has accused some firms of using customer payments like an "interest-free company credit card".

title: Wiltshire: Massive 60-year teddy bear collection up for auction
description: Ms Fairhurst bought her first bear in the 1960s and now has a 1,500 strong collection.

title: Britons wary of impending rail strikes
description: Rail users are braced for days of disruption across England, Scotland and Wales ahead of the biggest rail strike in 30 years.

title: Which trains will run in Scotland during the strike?
description: The operator will cancel 90% of its trains during three days of strike action by the RMT this week.

title: Chinese tornado rips through buildings and power cables
description: A tornado has severely damaged buildings, cars and infrastructure in the southern Chinese city Foshan.

title: Niamh Rodgers: 'We're highlighting asbestos dangers for daddy'
description: A bereaved family is searching for answers around their father's asbestos-related death.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Network derailed' and 'summer of discontent'
description: The biggest rail strike in 30 years, which starts on Tuesday, leads nearly all the front pages.

title: Matt Fitzpatrick: US Open champion on 'hit and hope' bunker shot that led to win
description: Matt Fitzpatrick admits that "one of the best shots" he has ever hit that led to him winning the US Open in Boston, was actually a "hit and hope".

title: Sudden unexplained death in childhood: 'Why did my beautiful son die?'
description: Cot deaths have inspired much awareness work - but what about when an older child dies unexpectedly?

title: County lines: Inside the complex battle against drug gangs exploiting children
description: The BBC has been given access to a new team that has to decide if children are criminals or victims.
